instruction: Generate example sentences for the phrase: "never give up".
output:
1. No matter how hard the challenge is, never give up. 
2. Perseverance is key, so never give up on your dreams. 
3. Believe in yourself and remind yourself that you should never give up.
4. When times are tough, never give up and keep pushing forward.
5. No matter what happens, you must never give up on yourself. 
6. Keep trying, never give up and you'll eventually achieve success. 
7. Don't let fear and doubt hold you back – never give up. 
8. When you hit a wall, never give up – there's always a way forward. 
9. Failing is part of the process, but never give up on yourself. 
10. Through hard work and dedication, never give up on your goals.

instruction: Name a common side effect of antibiotics.
output: A common side effect of antibiotics is an upset stomach, which can include symptoms such as feeling sick, stomach aches and pains, nausea, and vomiting. Other side effects may include skin rash, sensitivity to sunlight, changes in appetite, diarrhea, and changes in the normal bacteria in the gut. Antibiotics can also interfere with the effectiveness of other medications, such as birth control pills. More rarely, they can cause allergic reactions such as shortness of breath, rash, or anaphylaxis. Long-term use of antibiotics can also damage the health of the microbiome, an essential part of the human body, so it is important to only take antibiotics when they are prescribed.

instruction: Name 3 American cities that host the Olympics.
output: There are three American cities that have hosted the Olympics: Los Angeles, California (hosted in 1932 and 1984); Lake Placid, New York (hosted in 1932 and 1980); and Atlanta, Georgia (hosted in 1996).

instruction: Name 3 programming languages used for game development.
output: The three programming languages commonly used for game development are C++, Java, and C#. C++ is a general-purpose language used to code the core game mechanics of most major titles, while Java is used to develop mobile and web games. C# is lightweight and versatile, allowing developers to quickly create games with little overhead. It is also popular for creating 2D and 3D graphics.

instruction: Generate a unique hashtag for a yoga class.
output: #UnwindInYoga

instruction: Name a job where creativity is essential
output: Creativity is essential for jobs such as graphic designers, writers, web designers, photographers, artists, and marketers.

instruction: Compare the speed of traditional banking to online banking.
output: Traditional banking typically requires customers to physically be present at a bank branch or ATM to perform transactions, while online banking allows transactions to be done through a web-based or mobile platform. Online banking is typically much faster and more convenient, as transactions can be done quickly and remotely, reducing wait times and providing customers with more flexibility.

instruction: Describe any three types of visualization and provide one example of each.
output: Types of visualization include line graphs, scatter plots, and heat maps. A line graph is a type of chart which shows a line drawn between data points, often used to show change over time. An example of a line graph is a graph showing a country's GDP over a period of time. A scatter plot is used to identify relationships between two variables; the closer the data points, the stronger the correlation. An example of a scatter plot is a graph showing a correlation between income and education level in a city. A heat map is a type of chart which uses color-coding to visually represent data; darker colors represent higher values and lighter colors represent lower values. An example of a heat map is a map of earthquake activity, where darker colors represent a higher magnitude.

instruction: You need to summarize a text in three sentences.
input: The Santa Ana winds are strong, hot, dry winds that originate inland and affect coastal Southern California and northern Baja California, particularly in the late summer and fall. These winds, which usually arrive from October to March, can cause wildfires in the region, and can reach speeds of up to 80 miles per hour. These winds are created when high pressure air from the Great Basin of Nevada and Arizona moves towards the coast and decrease in elevation as it approaches the Pacific Ocean.
output: The Santa Ana winds are strong, hot, and dry winds that originate in the Great Basin and travel towards the Pacific Ocean. These winds can cause wildfires in the region and reach speeds of up to 80 miles an hour. They occur from October to March.

instruction: You are given two sentences, you need to find the similar words between them
input:
Sentence 1: The rainfall in California has been unusually high this year.
Sentence 2: The precipitation in California has been unusually low this season.
output: California, unusually, high, low.
